clutch.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to hold something tightly because you do not want to lose it
clutch.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She was clutching a bottle of champagne.
clutch.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to suddenly take hold of someone or something because you are frightened, in pain, or in danger
clutch.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He clutched at a pillar for support.
Tom fell to the ground clutching his stomach.
clutch.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if something clutches at your heart, you suddenly feel fear or nervousness
clutch.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the pedal that you press with your foot when driving a vehicle in order to change gear, or the part of the vehicle that this controls
clutch.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a tight hold that someone has on something
clutch.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: I shook myself free of her clutch.
